alert.note: Alert for Baca (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 16 at 7:56PM MDT until June 16 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Baca County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 830 PM MDT. * At 756 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Pritchett, or 12 miles west of Springfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Springfield. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
